qas.question: When was the Canada Corporations Act, Part II repealed?
What did the creation of the Canada Not-for-Profit Corporations Act mean for NPOs?

answers.text: incorporation as of right, by Articles of Incorporation

qas.question: When did Ontario adopt the Canada Not-for-Profit Corporations Act?
When does Ontario expect the Canada Not-for-Profits Corpaoations Act to go into effect?
When was the Canada Not-for-Profit corporations Act last ammended?

plausible_answers.text: the Canada Corporations Act, Part II - the Canada Not-for-Profit Corporations Act
Canada Corporations Act, Part II - the Canada Not-for-Profit Corporations Act

qas.question: What act did Ontario adopt in 2009?

plausible_answers.text: incorporation as of right, by Articles of Incorporation

qas.question: What two things did the anticipated election in 2009 mean for NPO's?
When did Ontario repeal the Canada Corporations Act?

context: During <a0_0><b9_0>2009<b9_0/><a0_0/>, the federal government enacted new legislation repealing <b5_0>the <b6_0>Canada Corporations Act, Part II - the Canada Not-for-Profit Corporations Act<b6_0/><b5_0/>. This Act was last amended on <a4_0>10 October 2011<a4_0/> and the act was current till 4 March 2013. It allows for <a1_0><b8_0>incorporation as of right, by Articles of Incorporation<b8_0/><a1_0/>; does away with the ultra vires doctrine for nonprofits; establishes them as legal persons; and substantially updates the governance provisions for nonprofits. Ontario also overhauled its legislation, adopting <b7_0>the Ontario Not-for-Profit Corporations Act<b7_0/> during <a2_0>2010<a2_0/>; pending the outcome of an anticipated election during October 2011,[dated info] the new Act is expected to be in effect as of <a3_0>1 July 2013<a3_0/>.
